TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit GetItemType extends ExchangeWebServices.BaseRequestType

Docs.summary: The class represents a request to get items from a mailbox in the Exchange database.

remarks.para: The GetItem and FindItem operations provide a similar set of information. The GetItem operation is used to get items after they have been found by using FindItem, GetEvents, or SyncFolderItems operations.
GetItem returns additional properties that are not returned by FindItem. The following table shows properties not returned by FindItem but are returned by GetItem.

example.para: The following example shows you how to get two items from the Exchange database. The request uses the default response shape with the Sensitivity property returned as an additional property. The response is checked for e-mail messages and calendar items. Be aware that if the only properties that are accessed are contained in the base class, casting to the appropriate type may not be necessary.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: The constructor initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::BaseItemIdType ^> ^ ItemIds { cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::BaseItemIdType ^> ^ get(); void set(cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::BaseItemIdType ^> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the collection of items to get.
Docs.value: The property returns a array that contains the identifiers of all the items to get.

remarks.para: The property is set with an type.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property ExchangeWebServices::ItemResponseShapeType ^ ItemShape { ExchangeWebServices::ItemResponseShapeType ^ get(); void set(ExchangeWebServices::ItemResponseShapeType ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the response shape of the GetItem response.
Docs.value: The property returns an object that describes the properties that are returned in a GetItem response.
